messages.message: We used to have the ability to deploy apps to the whole org - this seems to have disappeared. How can I find it/was it intentionally left out? We currently have Build projects in shared workspaces but are unable to share deployed apps (i.e both me and fernando both have deployed an app from the same build project on shared workspace where either of us cannot access the other’s)

once the app is created, you should see a share button on the top right that will allow you to share it with your org

CC: @Travis @Wilson
The app also has to be Production.
For sharing to be visible to other users

Okay, can some one help me with this then;

1. I created a project in shared workspace
2. I published it
3. Fernando enters the same project in shared workspace
4. Fernando publishes it
5. I now share a link to share to org
6. I share it to Fernando
7. Fernando plays around with my published link and clicks ‘edit app’
8. It goes back to the project in shared workspace
Which app is it editing

We have a situation now that each of our ‘Open App’ buttons on the same project, leads to different projects, so I’m anticipating this to be fairly confusing…
Be home in 20. And I’ll take a look.
@Gwen I’m walking through your steps now

• Fernando can access the same Project, but he would generate his own unique app when he publishes. This is because an app is unique by the `app name` and the `owner`.
• Fernando is not able to edit “your app”, and cannot even access the “Edit App” button when viewing your shared app.
• Fernando can generate an app of the identical name as you (sourced from the same Project) because, again, it is unique to him as an owner of the app.
Also when you both share your app you will see both apps shared on the app-store
